Class Robot

java.lang.Object
application.Robot
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasicRobot
public abstract class Robot extends Object
Abstract class representing a Robot.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(double mouseX, double mouseY)
      Checks if the given point (mouse click) is within the robot's radius.
      Parameters:
      mouseX - The x-coordinate of the mouse click.
      mouseY - The y-coordinate of the mouse click.
      Returns:
      True if the point is within the robot's radius, false otherwise.

    • move

      public abstract void move(double xLimit, double yLimit)
      Abstract method to move the robot based on limits.
      Parameters:
      xLimit - The maximum x-coordinate the robot can move.
      yLimit - The maximum y-coordinate the robot can move.

    • hitting

      public boolean hitting(double ox, double oy, double or)
      Checks if the robot is colliding with another object based on its position and radius.
      Parameters:
      ox - The x-coordinate of the other object.
      oy - The y-coordinate of the other object.
      or - The radius of the other object.
      Returns:
      True if the robot is colliding with the other object, false otherwise.

    • hitting

      public boolean hitting(Robot oRobot)
      Checks if the robot is colliding with another robot.
      Parameters:
      oRobot - The other robot to check for collision.
      Returns:
      True if the robot is colliding with the other robot, false otherwise.

    • getAngle

      public double getAngle()
      Gets the current angle of the robot.
      Returns:
      The current angle of the robot in degrees.

      public void setAngle(double angle)
      Sets the angle of the robot.
